head.title: To Keep the Mideast Talks Alive

hedline.hl1: To Keep the Mideast Talks Alive

abstract.p: Antonio Lopez letter says Palestinians believe that 'peace process' has always been 'damaged goods'

block.p: Chas. W. Freeman Jr. suggests a flawed view of what is at issue between Israel and the Palestinians: a deeply aggrieved people seeking redress of injuries (Op-Ed, Oct. 18).
Chas. W. Freeman Jr. suggests a flawed view of what is at issue between Israel and the Palestinians: a deeply aggrieved people seeking redress of injuries (Op-Ed, Oct. 18).

Yet if, as seems to be confirmed by events, Palestinian and Arab policy is to weaken Israel for the mortal blow, what is needed is a policy from Israel and the United States making it clear that there is no chance that any combination of Palestinians and Arab states could run Israel to the ground.

Honest brokers cannot resolve a situation like this. The United States should step back from the broker role. The role of broker implies, even demands, that the United States never waiver from moral equivalence in this struggle, which many believe would be a moral distortion.
M. DONALD COLEMAN Mamaroneck, N.Y., Oct. 18, 2000
